p: An aliquot of 250 μL of CIV17-EO was dissolved in 2 mL of mobile phase: hexane: ethyl acetate (98:2). Precoated silica-gel plates (silica gel 60 F 254; thickness 0.25 mm; Merck) with the same above mobile phase were used to control the fraction separations: after development, the plate was sprayed with phosphomolybdic acid solution (20% phosphomolybdic acid in EtOH) [ 40] and heated to 120 °C. The components of the essential oil showed an intense blue color on a yellow background. The solvents of collected fractions were evaporated to dryness with a rotary evaporator (RV 10 digital, IKA ®-Werke GmbH & CO. KG, Staufen im Breisgau, Germany).
